neptune.node

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • neptune.node.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArraySetNode, BasicNode, BinaryAnyOperatorNode, BinaryPrimitiveOperatorNode, CodeblockNode, ConstDeclarationNode, ElseNode, ForeachNode, FunctionCallNode, FunctionDeclarationNode, IfBlockNode, IfNode, LiteralNode, PrintNode, ProgramNode, ReadNode, ReturnNode, SizeOfNode, TypeNode, UnaryPrimitiveOperatorNode, VarDeclarationNode, VarIndexedNode, VarNode, WhileNode

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class that is used as the base of all other nodes.
    Author:
    Koen van Urk and Marcel Boersma

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Node.type
      Enum that defines all types of the Neptune language.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • validate

        public abstract void validate(Program p)
                       throws NeptuneException
        Method that validates the Node and its children. Each non-abstract node will implement custom logic here.
        Parameters:
        p - A program containing a symbol table.
        Throws:
        NeptuneException - Thrown in case of validation errors.

      • generate

        public abstract void generate(Program p,
            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> info)
                       throws NeptuneException
        Method that generates assembly instructions for the Node and its children. Each non-abstract node will implement custom logic here.
        Parameters:
        p - A program containing a symbol table and store for instructions.
        info - Key value storage used to pass on additional instructions from parent to child.
        Throws:
        NeptuneException - Thrown in case of symbol table errors.

      • typeMatch

        public boolean typeMatch(Node node)
        Matches a nodes type against another node using the typing rules of the Neptune language.
        Parameters:
        node - Node to check type against.
        Returns:
        true if type is equal according to the Neptune language rules, false otherwise.

      • getType

        public abstract Node.type getType()
        Retrieve the actual primitive type of a Node.
        Returns:
        Primitive type.

      • isArray

        public abstract boolean isArray()
        Retrieve the actual value for whether or not this Node is an array.
        Returns:
        true if element is an array, false otherwise.

      • isMutable

        public abstract boolean isMutable()
        Retrieve the actual value for whether or not this Node is mutable.
        Returns:
        true if element is mutable, false otherwise.

      • elemCount

        public abstract int elemCount()
        The number of elements contained in this Node. Only provides useful information when isArray() returns true.
        Returns:
        Number of elements.

      • typeDescription

        public java.lang.String typeDescription()
        Returns a string describing the type of this Node. Useful for debugging and providing error messages.
        Returns:
        A string describing the type of this Node.
